title: Bug 47910: ajc outjar jarfile does not contain MANIFEST.MF
description: When using the ajc command to create a .jar file, the resulting file does not contain the required MANIFEST.MF file, even though there is a METAINF/MANIFEST.MF file present inside the source directory.
OB: I call the ajc command with sourceroots set to '<mydir>' and outjar set to '<my.jar>'. The command successfully creates an output file with a .jar extension.
EB: The resulting .jar file is not a valid .jar file because it does not contain the required MANIFEST.MF file.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Run the ajc command with the 'sourceroots' parameter set to '<mydir>'
2. Specify the 'outjar' parameter as '<my.jar>'
3. Verify that the output file is created with a .jar extension
4. Check the contents of the resulting .jar file and confirm that it does not contain the MANIFEST.MF file.
